website_summaries.verdict: The LG G Pad 7.0 strikes a nice balance between price and features, making it a good starting point for entry-level Android tablets.

customer_reviews.title: Gem in the pack
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many of these cheap tabs you expect the rubbish low def screen, rubbish battery life, rubbish sound, this LG breaks the rules, the screen is good, it's fast, it has above average sound quality, a battery life to die for and most of all it's light as a feather. Now I might have got a good one who knows but if they are all like this I wouldn't hesitate in getting another and i'm probably the biggest pain in the arse buyer that Amazon have in the U.K for standards.
customer_reviews.author: Picard

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable and too little memory
customer_reviews.text: This was my first Android device so did struggle with it, but I found the very limited amount of available memory shocking - an SD card is essential. However after about 6 months it 'crashed' and now just constantly reboots without getting to the 'desktop'. I've tried a factory default reset (and lost all my data) but still not working - so It'll have to go back for repairs as there is no was of repairing myself (the whole unit is sealed)... Not sure if 6 months means it's still under warranty...
customer_reviews.author: AdoPlaydough

customer_reviews.title: LG delivers: Android 5.0.2 update now available for this tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Android 5.0.2 is now available. - Screen brightness is OK. - Battery life is good. - Haven't been able to scratch screen without protector. Great. - Storage can be expanded with a 32 GB SD Card. - Speakers are OK, but far from great. - Size is great. - Front camera for things like Skype is OK. Cons: - Back camera leaves a lot to be desired. - Using backspace is quirky with the LG word suggestion, but can easily be fixed in settings.
